text: February unemployment rates ranged from 2.9% in SD to 9.2% in HI.
Only IA, SD, UT, and WA saw an increase in GDP from Q4 2019 to Q4 2020.
In Q4 2020, nine states saw annual house price growth over 10% for the first time in three decades.
Average private weekly earnings in February ranged from $758 in MS to $1,844 in DC.
Leisure and hospitality jobs were down 25% or more over the year in 10 states and DC.
Unemployment rates remain above their Great Recession peaks in CT, HI, LA, NY, and ND.
NY’s accommodation and food services GDP fell 46% between Q4 2019 and Q4 2020.
State and local government jobs declined at least 5% over the year in 31 states.
Retail employment in February 2021 was higher than in February 2020 for 15 states.
From Q4 2019 to Q4 2020, house price increases ranged from 1.5% in DC to 21.1% in ID.
Manufacturing GDP increased in 44 states and DC between Q3 2020 and Q4 2020.
